You are not passing the indices in the right format. index_put_ expect the index tensor to be the transpose of what you passed.
So this works

target = torch.zeros([5,3])
indices = torch.LongTensor([[0,1], [1, 2], [2, 2], [3, 0], [4, 1]])
value = torch.ones(indices.shape[0])
target.index_put_(tuple(indices.t()), value)

Also, it is generally better to use advanced indexing in such cases, as it's more clear what it is doing

target[idx1, idx2] = 1

Closing as not a bug.

body:
You are not passing the `indices` in the right format. `index_put_` expect the index tensor to be the transpose of what you passed.
So this works

```python
target = torch.zeros([5,3])
indices = torch.LongTensor([[0,1], [1, 2], [2, 2], [3, 0], [4, 1]])
value = torch.ones(indices.shape[0])
target.index_put_(tuple(indices.t()), value)
```

Also, it is generally better to use advanced indexing in such cases, as it's more clear what it is doing
```python
target[idx1, idx2] = 1
```

Closing as not a bug.
